<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 217, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 87, 658, 262]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 282, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{(A - B)x}\), where \(A\) and \(B\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.4, 3.6) and (2.9, 14.1), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 344, 579, 363]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(A\) and \(B\) correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 344, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 87, 730, 246]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 262, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{6}{2x + 3}\). The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the lines \(x = 6\) and \(y = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 320, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region, giving your answer in the form \(a - \ln b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[301, 92, 761, 349]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 369, 520, 389]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = 3 - \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 405, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
**On the diagram,** sketch the graph of \(y = |5x - 4|\), and show that the equation \(3 - \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x} = |5x - 4|\) has exactly two real roots. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 470, 809, 492]]<|/det|>
It is given that the two roots of \(3 - \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x} = |5x - 4|\) are denoted by \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\), where \(\alpha < \beta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 148, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 594, 522]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that \(\alpha\) lies between 0.36 and 0.37.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 522]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 720, 144, 737]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 720, 920, 755]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{5}\big(7 - \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x_n}\big)\) to find \(\beta\) correct to 4 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[279, 87, 747, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 293, 920, 329]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x}(x^2 - 5x + 4)\). The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at the points \(A\) and \(B\), and has a maximum at the point \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 342, 146, 359]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 342, 485, 359]]<|/det|>
Find the exact gradient of the curve at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 342, 920, 359]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 571, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that \(4 \sin (\theta + \frac{1}{3}\pi) \cos (\theta - \frac{1}{3}\pi) \equiv \sqrt{3} + 2 \sin 2\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 650, 185, 668]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 650, 479, 668]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(4 \sin \frac{17}{2} \pi \cos \frac{1}{24} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 650, 920, 668]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 386, 92]]<|/det|>
A curve has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 625, 131]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{2t + 3}{t + 2},\qquad y = t^{2} + at + 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 776, 156]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant. It is given that, at the point \(P\) on the curve, the gradient is 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 170, 146, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 168, 556, 186]]<|/det|>
Show that the value of \(t\) at \(P\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 194, 655, 214]]<|/det|>
\[2t^{3} + (a + 8)t^{2} + (4a + 8)t + 4a - 1 = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 196, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \((t + 1)\) is a factor of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 100, 641, 120]]<|/det|>
\[2t^{3} + (a + 8)t^{2} + (4a + 8)t + 4a - 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 138, 316, 156]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 138, 920, 156]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 444, 186, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 444, 757, 463]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(P\) is the only point on the curve at which the gradient is 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 444, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 75, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
